tit.cmt: クォーテーション削除、単語の頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 几帳（きちょう）は、平安時代以降公家の邸宅に使われた。
sen.e: The `Kicho` screen ｗas used by nobles in their residences from the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The `Kicho` screen ｗas used by nobles in their residences from the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The 'Kicho' screen was used by nobles in their residences from the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 全角→半角に修正、クォーテーション表記修正

sen.j: 二本のＴ字型の柱に薄絹を下げた間仕切りの一種。
sen.e: The `Kicho` screen is made of 2 `T` shaped supports from which diaphanous silk cloth was hung to form a type of room divider.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The `Kicho` screen is made of 2 `T` shaped supports from which diaphanous silk cloth was hung to form a type of room divider.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Kicho screen is made of two 'T' shaped supports from which diaphanous silk cloth was hung to form a type of room divider.
sen.cmt: Kicho screenとし、全角→半角に修正、クォーテーション表記修正、"2"をスペルアウト

sen.j: 簾の内側に立てて二重の障壁とするほか、可動式の間仕切り・目隠しとして大きな部屋の仕切りに使った。
sen.e: Besides being set up on the internal side of bamboo screens (to in effect from a double barrier), the `Kicho` screen was employed in large rooms as a moveable room divider and to obscure things from view etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Besides being set up on the internal side of bamboo screens (to in effect from a double barrier), the `Kicho` screen was employed in large rooms as a moveable room divider and to obscure things from view etc.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Besides being set up on the internal side of bamboo screens (to in effect from a double barrier), the Kicho screen was employed in large rooms as a moveable room divider and to obscure things from view etc.
sen.cmt: Kicho screenとし、eｔcを半角に修正

sen.j: 参拝の折など高貴の婦人の身を衆目から隠す障壁、荷物などを見苦しくないよう隠しておく目隠しなどとしてわりに広い用途に用いられた。
sen.e: The screens ｗere also used in a wide range of applications such as to block public view on noble women when visiting shrines and to obscure unsightly baggage/stored items from view.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The screens ｗere also used in a wide range of applications such as to block public view on noble women when visiting shrines and to obscure unsightly baggage/stored items from view.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The screens were also used in a wide range of applications such as to block public view on noble women when visiting shrines and to obscure unsightly baggage/stored items from view.
sen.cmt: 全角→半角に修正

sen.j: 変わった用途としては、女房が街道を歩くときに傍仕えの女の童二人に小型の几帳を持たせて顔を隠す「差几帳（さしきちょう）」がある。
sen.e: Unorthodox uses of the `Kicho` screens included; use of smaller sized divider screens ('sashi kicho') which were carried by a pair of female attendants and used to obscure the faces of noble women when walking along open roads.

Unorthodox uses of the `Kicho` screens included; use of smaller sized divider screens ('sashi kicho') which were carried by a pair of female attendants and used to obscure the faces of noble women when walking along open roads.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Unorthodox uses of the Kicho screens included; use of smaller sized divider screens ('sashi kicho') which were carried by a pair of female attendants and used to obscure the faces of noble women when walking along open roads.
sen.cmt: Kicho screensとし、クォーテーション表記修正

sen.j: 几帳に用いる薄絹を「帷（かたびら）」、Ｔの上の部分に当たる横木を「手」、Ｔの縦棒に当たる柱を「足」、根元の台を「土居（つちい）」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The diaphanous silk used in 'Kitcho` screens is called `Katabira`, the upper sections off either side of the upper part of the `T` are called `arms`, the vertical uprights are called `legs` and, the base is called the 'Tsuchii` (lit. 'on the ground').

The diaphanous silk used in 'Kitcho` screens is called `Katabira`, the upper sections off either side of the upper part of the `T` are called `arms`, the vertical uprights are called `legs` and, the base is called the 'Tsuchii` (lit. 'on the ground').
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The diaphanous silk used in Kicho screens is called 'Katabira,' the upper sections off either side of the upper part of the 'T' are called 'arms,' the vertical uprights are called 'legs' and, the base is called the 'Tsuchii' (lit. 'on the ground').
sen.cmt: ‘Kitcho` screens→Kitcho screens→Kicho screensに修正、クォーテーション表記修正、カンマの位置を移動、余分なスペース消去

sen.j: 几帳の丈は土居の高さも含めて測る。
sen.e: When measuring the height of a Kitcho screen, the base is included in the measurement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When measuring the height of a Kitcho screen, the base is included in the measurement.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: When measuring the height of a Kicho screen, the base is included in the measurement.
sen.cmt: Kitcho→Kichoに修正

sen.j: 簾の内側に立てる高さ四尺幅八尺・帷が長さ六尺幅五幅（薄絹五枚使用）の大型タイプ（四尺の几帳）がある。
sen.e: Ｗhen set on the inner side of bamboo blinds, large sized types of Kitcho blinds were 4 shaku (1 shaku = 3０.3 cm) high and 8 shaku wide or, width and length of 6 shaku in 5 widths that used 5 sheets of thin silk.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ｗhen set on the inner side of bamboo blinds, large sized types of Kitcho blinds were 4 shaku (1 shaku = 3０.3 cm) high and 8 shaku wide or, width and length of 6 shaku in 5 widths that used 5 sheets of thin silk.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: When set on the inner side of bamboo blinds, large sized types of Kicho blinds were 4 shaku (1 shaku = 30.3 cm) high and 8 shaku wide or, width and length of 6 shaku in 5 widths that used 5 sheets of thin silk.
sen.cmt: 全角表記→半角に修正、Kitcho→Kicho、3０.3→30.3に修正

sen.j: 室内用の高さ三尺幅六尺・帷が長さ五尺幅四幅（薄絹四枚使用）の中型タイプ（三尺の几帳）がある。
sen.e: Mid-sized Kitcho screens used indoors were 3 shaku wide by 6 shaku high in 4 widths, that used 4 sheets of thin silk,.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Mid-sized Kitcho screens used indoors were 3 shaku wide by 6 shaku high in 4 widths, that used 4 sheets of thin silk,.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Mid-sized Kicho screens used indoors were 3 shaku wide by 6 shaku high in 4 widths, that used 4 sheets of thin silk.
sen.cmt: 全角表記→半角に修正、Kitcho→Kichoに修正、不要なカンマ削除

sen.j: 皇族女子などが帳台の中に使う高さ二尺幅一尺五寸の小型タイプ（枕几帳）、の三種類がある。
sen.e: Small types of Kitcho screen (2 shaku wide x 1.5 shaku high) were used by royal womenfolk in their living chambers (next to their pillows).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Small types of Kitcho screen (2 shaku wide x 1.5 shaku high) were used by royal womenfolk in their living chambers (next to their pillows).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Small types of Kicho screen (2 shaku wide x 1.5 shaku high) were used by royal womenfolk in their living chambers (next to their pillows).
sen.cmt: Kitcho→Kichoに修正

sen.j: 枕几帳は横木を紫檀で表地を二陪織物で作る豪勢なものである。
sen.e: Kitcho screens used next to the pillow were extravagant objects where the cross bar was made of rosewood from which hung double weave silk.
Kitcho screens used next to the pillow were extravagant objects where the cross bar was made of rosewood from which hung double weave silk.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kicho screens used next to the pillow were extravagant objects where the cross bar was made of rosewood from which hung double weave silk.
sen.cmt: Kitcho→Kichoに修正

sen.j: 帷には普通は紐や表裏ともに平絹を使うが表地にのみ綾を使ったこともある。
sen.e: Only woven silk was normally used for both layers of the curtain and cords.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Only woven silk was normally used for both layers of the curtain and cords.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Plain silk was normally used for both layers of the curtain and cords, but sometimes twill was used only for the outer materials.
sen.cmt: 文頭のOnly削除、「表地にのみ綾を使ったこともある」を訳出、「平絹」と「綾」を対比させるため、woven silk→Plain silkに修正

sen.j: 上部を筒型に縫って横木を通し縫った上刺しの紐の余りは蜷結びにして長々と垂らす。
sen.e: The upper part was stitched together to make a cylinder through which the cross bar was passed and, excess cord was tied in a ninamusubi knot.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The upper part was stitched together to make a cylinder through which the cross bar was passed and, excess cord was tied in a ninamusubi knot.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The upper part was stitched together to make a cylinder through which the cross bar was passed and, excess cord was tied in a ninamusubi knot.
sen.cmt: OK

sen.j: 絹布一枚ごとに紐で吊るして中央に「野筋（のすじ）」という紅（後には黒と紅の分割）の飾り紐を垂らす。
sen.e: A red and later on a red and black silk cord ('nosuji` decorative string) was hung from the center of each piece of silk cloth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: A red and later on a red and black silk cord ('nosuji` decorative string) was hung from the center of each piece of silk cloth.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
